title: On a Budget? Don't Miss the Top 10 Free Things...
text:
Planning a Trip to Madrid Got flights to Madrid? These are your next steps... joncrel/Flickr/CC BY-ND 2.0 1. Museo de Reina Sofia 
The Reina Sofia is Madrid's world-famous modern art gallery - and it has free entry for a limited time every day. That means you can see many works by Salvador Dali and Pablo Picasso - including the latter's masterpiece, the Guernica - completely free. 
When is it free? Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday 7pm to 9pm, Sundays 1:30pm to 7pm. The museum is closed on Tuesdays. More Â» 
continue reading below our video Best Ride Sharing Apps of 2015 Image: Damian Corrigan 2. Museo del Prado 
Officially Spain's most popular tourist sight and free seven days a week! The Museo del Prado is Spain's premier art gallery, housing the finest works of art Spain has ever produced. 
When is it free? Monday to Saturday 6pm to 8pm and Sundays and holidays from 5pm to 7pm.
